gurmukhi: ਧਾੲਿ ਧਾੲਿ ਕਰੈਂ ਪ੍ਹਾਰਨ ਤਿੱਛ ਤੇਗ ਕੰਪਾੲਿ ॥੪॥੬੮॥
transliteration: Dhaae Dhaae Karaoon Prahaaran Tichchh Teg Kanpaae||4||68||
translation: They are running and striking blows, causing their sharp swords to shake and glitter. 4.68

gurmukhi: ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਲਗੇ ਜਿਤੇ ਸਭ ਫੂਲ ਮਾਲ ਹੁਅੈ ਗੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Sastra Astra Lage Jite Sabh Phool Maal Huai Gad||
translation: All the blows of weapons and arms, which struck the goddess, they appeared as garlands of flowers around her neck.

gurmukhi: ਕੋਪ ਓਪ ਬਿਲੋਕਿ ਅਦਿਭੁਤ ਦਾਨਵੰ ਬਿਸਮੈ ਭੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Kop Op Bilok(i) Adibhout Daanavan Bismai Bhae||
translation: Seeing this all the demons were filled with anger and astonishment.

gurmukhi: ਦੳੁਰ ਦੳੁਰ ਅਨੇਕ ਅਾਯੁਧ ਫੇਰ ਫੇਰ ਪ੍ਹਾਰ ਹੀਂ ॥
transliteration: Daur Daur Anek Aayudh Pher Pher Prahaar Hoon||
translation: Many of them, running ahead repeatedly strike blows with their weapons.

gurmukhi: ਜੂਝ ਜੂਝ ਗਿਰੇ ਅਰੇਕ ਸੁ ਮਾਰ ਮਾਰ ਪੁਕਾਰ ਹੀਂ ॥੫॥੬੯॥
transliteration: Joojh Joojh Giredarek Su Maar Maar Poukaar Hoon||5||69||
translation: And with shouts of “kill, kill”, they are fighting and falling down.5.69.

gurmukhi: ਰੇਲ ਰੇਲ ਚਲੇ ਹੲੇਂਦ੍ਰਨ ਪੇਲ ਪੇਲ ਗਜੇਂਦ੍ਰ ॥
transliteration: Rel Rel Chale Haaandran Pel Pel Gadendra||
translation: The horse-rider generals are driving forward theh horses and the elephant-rider generals are goading their elephants.

gurmukhi: ਝੇਲ ਝੇਲ ਅਨੰਤ ਅਾਯੁਧ ਹੇਲ ਹੇਲ ਰਿਪੇਂਦ੍ਰ ॥
transliteration: Jhel Jhel Anant Aayudh Hel Hel Ripendra||
translation: Facing unlimited weapons, the enemies’ generals, enduring the blows, are still making an assault.

gurmukhi: ਗਾਹਿ ਗਾਹਿ ਫਿਰੇ ਫਵੱਜਨ ਬਾਹਿ ਬਾਹਿ ਖਤੰਗ ॥
transliteration: Gadh(i) Gadh(i) Phire Phavajjan Baah(i) Baah(i) Khatan||
translation: The armies crushing the warriors are marching forward and showering their arrows.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਗ ਭੰਗ ਗਿਰੇ ਕਹੂੰ ਰਣ ਰੰਗ ਸੂਰ ੳੁਤੰਗ ॥੬॥੭੦॥
transliteration: An Bhaaag Gire Kahoon Ran Ran Soor Outan||6||70||
translation: Many heroic fighters, becoming limbless, have fallen down in the battlefield.6.70.

gurmukhi: ਝਾਰ ਝਾਰ ਫਿਰੇ ਸਰੋਤਮ ਡਾਰਿ ਝਾਰਿ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਨ ॥
transliteration: Jhaar Jhaar Phire Darotam Daar(i) Jdaar(i) Dripaan||
translation: Some where the shafts are falling like rain-showers and somewhere the swords are striking blows collectively.

gurmukhi: ਸੈਲ ਸੇ ਰਣ ਪੁੰਜ ਕੁੰਜਰ ਸੂਰ ਸੀਸ ਬਖਾਨ ॥
transliteration: Sail Se Ran Pounj Kounjar Soor Soos Bakhaan||
translation: The elephants seen together are like stony rocks and the heads of the warriors appear like stones.

gurmukhi: ਬੱਕ੍ਰ ਨੱਕ੍ਰ ਭੁਜਾ ਸੁ ਸੋਭਤ ਚੱਕ੍ਰ ਸੇ ਰਥ ਚੱਕ੍ਰ ॥
transliteration: Bakkra Nakkra Bhujaa Su Sobhat Chakkra Se Rath Chakkra||
translation: The crooked arms appear like octopus and the chariot wheels are like tortoises.

gurmukhi: ਕੇਸ ਪਾਸ ਸਿਬਾਲ ਸੋਹਤ ਅਸਥ ਚੂਰ ਸਰੱਕ੍ਰ ॥੭॥੭੧॥
transliteration: Kes Paas Sibaal Shoat Asath Choor Sarakkra||7||71||
translation: The hair seem like noose and scum and the crushed bones like sand.7.71.

gurmukhi: ਸੱਜਿ ਸੱਜਿ ਚਲੇ ਹਥਯਾਰਨ ਗੱਜਿ ਗੱਜਿ ਗਜੇਂਦ੍ਰ ॥
transliteration: Sajj(i) Sajj(i) Chale Hathyaaran Gadj(i) Gadj(i) Gadendra||
translation: The warriors have bedecked themselves with weapons and the elephants are roaring wihil moving forward.
